author: LaurentDardenne
body:
When I create an instance of the Powershell class by specifying an InitialSessionState,  the 'IsRunspaceOwner' property is not updated.

Steps to reproduce
------------------
```powershell
try {
  $InitialSessionState=  [System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState]::Create()
  
 $SessionStateCmdletEntry = New-Object System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.SessionStateCmdletEntry 'Get-ChildItem','Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetChildItemCommand',$null
 $InitialSessionState.Commands.Add($SessionStateCmdletEntry)

 $Provider = New-Object System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.SessionStateProviderEntry 'FileSystem',([Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.FileSystemProvider]),$null
 $InitialSessionState.Providers.Add($Provider)

  $PS = [PowerShell]::Create($InitialSessionState)
  Write-Warning "Automatic release : $($ps.IsRunspaceOwner)"
   $PS.AddCommand("Get-ChildItem") > $null
   $Results = $PS.Invoke()                        
  Write-Warning "Automatic release : $($ps.IsRunspaceOwner)"

}
finally {
 $PS.Dispose()
}
$PS.Runspace
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
WARNING: Automatic release : False
WARNING: Automatic release : True

 Id Name            ComputerName    Type          State         Availability
 -- ----            ------------    ----          -----         ------------
  2 Runspace2       localhost       Local         Closed        None
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
#WARNING: Automatic release : False
#WARNING: Automatic release : False

$PS.Runspace

#  Id Name            ComputerName    Type          State         Availability
#  -- ----            ------------    ----          -----         ------------
#   2 Runspace2       localhost       Local         Opened        Available
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
Same error with  Windows Powershell : 
```
> $PSVersionTable
```

comments.body:
`IsRunspaceOwner = true` means that a runspace is created by the PowerShell object.
`IsRunspaceOwner = false` means that a runspace is created out of the PowerShell object and assigned to the PowerShell object.

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/c1c5344a8897262433141ecbc13bb06ac2c4bbef/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/hostifaces/PowerShell.cs#L1808
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/c1c5344a8897262433141ecbc13bb06ac2c4bbef/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/hostifaces/PowerShell.cs#L1757
